news.title: Embattled China Evergrande warns of cross-default, liquidity crunch
news.para: The group has been scrambling to raise funds it needs to pay its many lenders and suppliers, with regulators and financial markets worried that any crisis could ripple through China's banking system.

news.title: IRDAI asks insurers to come out with new title insurance policies
news.para: Title insurance is a form of indemnity insurance that protects the potential owner of a property against financial loss from defects in title to the real property.

news.title: Real estate demand falls in Moscow after mortgage rate increase
news.para: State mortgage subsidies were introduced last year to inject some life into Russia's struggling economy, hit by the global coronavirus pandemic and an oil price crash.

news.title: Regularization letter dues paid to Nagpur civic body, NIT asks plot owners to pay it again
news.para: For the last five months, over 500 plot owners are running between Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) and Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT) for getting regularization letter (RL).

news.title: West Bengal sets ball rolling for digital vigil on sand mining
news.para: ​In addition to 24/7 CCTV camera surveillance at the mines and stockyards, all vehicles ferrying sand must have RFID tags or GPS to facilitate calculation of trips made.

news.title: Congress asks Ulhasnagar civic body to abolish 73.5% tax on rental properties
news.para: District president of Ulhasnagar Congress, Rohit Salve, has given a 10-day ultimatum to UMC commissioner Dr Raja Dayanidhi demanding the cancellation of this tax. He has written a letter about the same to the commissioner.

news.title: Sale of imported sand from Malaysia to resume from next month in Karnataka
news.para: However, the State Government had to do a lot to get the deal finalised. MSIL wanted to sell 50-kg bag sand for Rs 200. But many builders in the city prefer M-sand for construction activities.

news.title: Glitches in Lucknow civic body's portal bug property tax payers
news.para: Several property owners are having a hard time in depositing their property tax online due to glitches in LMC’s website.

news.title: West Bengal eases norms for brick kilns
news.para: Chief secretary H K Dwivedi said the state was simplifying norms for registration of kilns and, thus, many unregistered kilns could now be brought within the ambit of government monitoring.

news.title: Agra: No highrises to be built in 1.5-km radius behind Taj Mahal
news.para: “No construction higher than 25m can come up behind the Taj Mahal so the panoramic view of the monument is visible without an obstruction in the background,” said Dr Rajendra Pensiya, vice chairperson of the Agra Development Authority.

news.title: Government will distribute 13,500 land titles: Kerala CM
news.para: ​The CM, in a post on his Facebook page, said the "pattayam mela" for land allotment will be carried out on Tuesday in 14 district centres and 77 taluk centres in the state.

news.title: About 700 buildings were identified as dangerous in pre-monsoon survey: NDMC
news.para: "During this survey, 699 properties or structures were found in a dangerous condition and 444 structures were identified as needing necessary repairs," a senior NDMC official said.

news.title: Delhi government to provide financial aid to install rainwater harvesting systems
news.para: ​The Delhi Jal Board (DJB) had earlier issued guidelines mandating owners of existing and new properties measuring 100 square metres and above to install RWH structures.

news.title: HFCs' asset under management remains flat in Q1 FY22: Icra Ratings
news.para: "Given this subdued disbursements and portfolio rundown in the absence of any moratorium like in Q1 FY2021, the (AUM) for NBFC-segment shrunk in Q1 FY2022, while the HFC AUM remained flat," the agency said.

news.title: Noida authority asks SC to relook interest rate cap for realtors
news.para: As the bench asked how is it possible to recall the order after one year, against the backdrop of claims that some of the builders might have benefited, counsel submitted that after the top court's June 10 order, everything has been halted. "Not a single paisa has been paid in the last one year," he told the bench.
